draft-comment.p: All links to external resources should be entered in the boilerplate file for ease of maintenance and inserted by conkeyref where needed.

Do not include conrefs or conkeyrefs to this same boilerplate file in boilerplate text. Oxygen and the Toolkit CMS can handle this fine, but it is too recursive for the ALA publishing script to handle and the conref/conkeyref will not display in the published text, resulting in mysterious blanks.

body.draft-comment: Recommendations limited to specific sets of elements

p.ph: Note that each distinct edition statement, including designations of edition, their associated designations of named revision of edition, statements of responsibility relating to edition, etc., should be encoded in separate 250 fields.

For specific MLA guidance on places, dates, or agents related to the production, publication, distribution, or manufacture of a manifestation, refer to the appropriate narrower element. Otherwise follow LC-PCC PS for this element.

If the resource is a reprint, reissue, reproduction, issue in an alternate format, etc., and provides an identifier for the original manifestation or an equivalent in an alternate format, record the identifier as a Manifestation: ; do this in addition to formulating a structured or unstructured description of the original manifestation.

body.p: For notated music, refer to the special instructions at Extent of manifestations of notated music. Otherwise apply the option if appropriate.

div.p: If multiple terms for notated music resources are needed, do not record the terms in alphabetical order. Instead, order terms in the following order of precedence:

p.ph: A list of commonly used reference sources for preferred titles in music is available at
There is no priority order of reference sources, and the most appropriate source(s) to consult will vary based on the work.

body.p: Reference sources include, but are not limited to, music encyclopedias, thematic catalogs and other bibliographies, and authorized access points for similar works by the same composer found in the Library of Congress/NACO Authority File.

For titles consisting solely of the name of one type of composition, evaluate evidence in manifestation of the work and reference sources broadly. In some cases research will support a preferred title in a language other than the original language used by the composer.
